text: I now give the floor to his
Excellency salom maai kamasi Deputy
Prime Minister and Minister for foreign
affairs of the LA people's Democratic
Republic
I have great pleasure in
welcoming Mr
President at the outset I would like to
extend my profound
congratulation to his Excellency Dennis
Francis on his election as president of
the 78th session of the United Nation
general assembly and I wish him a very
successful
presidency
today the International Community is
facing a multiple crisis at a level we
had never experienced
before following the negative impacts of
coid 19 pandemic the major challenges
facing developing countries varies from
an increasing extreme poverty external
debt and unjust International Financial
architecture to extreme natural
calamities
external debt unjust International
Financial architecture to extreme
natural climes as seen in many parts of
the world especially the recent natural
disasters that occurred in Morocco in
Libya I join other speakers in
expressing our sympathy and condolences
to the people of Morocco and
Libya this has already been compounded
by Regional tensions and unilateral
measures as a result of geopolitical
rivalry all this has not only hampered
the hard-earned development progress
during the last decades but also
threaten the survival of
humankind at this critical
juncture most the most appropriate
solution are needed in order to address
such challenges it requires unified and
Collective actions that are Guided by
the principles ens shines in the United
Nation Charter and we must firmly uphold
multilateralism in tackling them to save
our world from another
catastrophe our shares wisdom and United
political determination are more
critical than ever this must be done by
putting aside any unilateral interest
and resolutely avoiding greater confront
a and division among the UN member
states to this end the United Nations
must be reformed in a way that it it can
effectively fulfill its mandate we need
the UN that is more relevant and
effective in the rapidly changing
geopolitical landscape and be able to
address the challenges threatening
International Peace security and
sustainable development we believe that
we are now better equipped to tackle
Global challenges which include among
others scientific technological
advancement
Innovation yet without common desire
shares responsibilities and Collective
action the most vulnerable people in the
world will continue to be left
behind Mr
President resolving global conflict and
disputes by peace peaceful means is the
only viable way to ensure longlasting
peace and
coexistence in this regard we Ur an
immediate end to the conflict in Ukraine
through peaceful dialogues without which
we all would continue to be
impacted we also demand a peaceful
solution to the Middle East problem the
LA pedia Calles for the old parties
concern to resume dialogue and Resort
restore Mutual trust for solving the
long overdue Palestinian issue through
the establishment of two sovereign state
coexisting peaceful in Lin with the
relevant UN
resolution like many others the LA PDR
believes that
unilateralism particularly uni
unilateral cohesive measures not only
contravenes the principle of the UN
Charter and international law but also
severely cause negative consequences to
innocent people hinder
International development of many
developing countries in this regard my
delegation contined to join Global Co
for lifting the economic embargo against
Cuba and removing it from the list of

ending own unilateral cohesive
measures Mr
President approaching the point the
midpoint of implementation of 2030

countries are still lacking behind
therefore
development
therefore we must further strengthen and

include harnessing scientific and
Technology Tech olic technological

heads of state and governments of

want one of the driving mechanism of

2030 agenda in this context Global

economic development environment
conservation poverty reduction and
addressing

system development partners and

supporting countries in special

to address their specific
challenges it is evidence that one of
the key obstacle to SG
implementation has always been
insufficient financing let me quote the
call by the UN Secretary General
cter the Global financ Financial system

to benefit wealthy country in of Court
this is a clear signal that the reform

and global economic governance in order

economic

just a global Development Goal but for

in addition to
17 Global sdt the LA pdia has sdt 18
which is Achieve lives Sav from

poses an obstacle to other
SG we therefore take this opportunity to
call for continue support and assistance
from the International Community to
address these prolonged and challenging
tasks for the remaining of for
remainders of sdt their integration into
our national strategies signifies our
unwavering dedication despite our great
effort the progr base remain less than

carrying out the third voluntary
National Review process conducting track

what need more attention and support we
will present our vnr at the 2024 high
level political Forum in addition the LA
government has taken various measures
including development of finan financing
strategy as part of the integrated
National financing framework with a view
to building a more resilient National

opening a window of opportunity to meet
the financing needs
as for the LDC graduation effort we are
embarking on the adoption of the
national smooth transition strategy
which will help the government
development partners and relevant
stakeholders to stay focused more on
development priorities addressing the
most pressing needs and
challenges that may disrupt the
country's graduation
process Mr President the LA pedia has
considerable natural Capital Rich
biodiversity and abundance Water
Resources with opportunity to renewable
energy development and investment in
carbon capture and storage which can
provide the country with significant
development Potentials in this context
we see the important role of science
technology and innovation in advancing
the country's National development
agenda to promote green and inclusive
growth as well as digital economy over
resourc driven economies with a view to
enhancing sustainable use of Natural
Resources in this connection the laia
has adopted its National digital economy
development vision and
strategy although the ledia is among the
countries who contribute the least to
Global emission like others we are the
victim of climate change nevertheless we
are strongly Comm committed ourself to
the international climate obligations
the LA government has already adopted
National strategy for climate change but
to ensure its full and effective
implementation it requires sufficient
Financial Resources as well as technical
assistance that means an access to
climate finance and other funding
resources which would greatly support
developing countries in this regard my
country's Ur urges to realize the
international commitment particularly US
dollar 1 billion 100 billion in climate
Finance for countries in needs the most
to this end our delegation trust that
the outcome of the climate ambition
Summit 2023 will lay a foundation for
concrete actions in the lead up to cop
28 Mr President this year marks the 56th
anniversaries of the establishment of
Association of Southeast Asian Nation or
asan as an intergovernmental
Organization for regional
cooperation asan has not only uphold the
regionalism and
multilateralism but also played a
central role in maintaining and
promoting peace security and development
in the region we in asan are committed
to further strengthen the asan community
as well as enhancing Asian unity and
centrality in our engagement with
external Partners including through
Asian lead mechanism in order to promote
an enabling environment for peace
stability and prosperity in the region
and
Beyond in
2024 the the LA PDR we assume the Assan
chairmanship with the theme asan
enhancing connectivity and resilience
the LA pedia will continue to build upon
the past achievement of asan in
strengthening the Assan community and
enhancing asan external relations with
our partners for more connected and
resilient
asan in conclusion I would like to
reiterate the laia's commitment to
multilateralism with the United Nation
at the core as well as the firm
determination to advancing the
implementation of the three pillar of
sustainable development economic social
and environmental so no one is Left
